trans-unit.source: The base TextControl class is an abstract class from which concrete text-based controls are derived.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextBox>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Label>, <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Link>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Command> controls are examples of controls derived from the TextControl class.
Every control that is based on the TextControl class has a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property, which can be programmatically modified.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl.Text%2A> property is usually used to render the control.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl"></xref> class.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
Sets or returns the text for the control.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
For an object that inherits the Text property from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.TextControl> class, this property renders the text of the control.
The default value is an empty string.
The Text property can be specified by using the Text attribute, or as inner text.
If the Text property is specified in both ways, the inner text always takes precedence.
However, if the Text property is programmatically set, the inner text is automatically removed and the newly set property takes precedence.
